captions.text:
Welcome to Chemistry 101, introduction to
chemistry

If you're here because of Breaking Bad, raise
your hand.

My thesis basically revolves around the effects
of christian infographics and Pagan element
On modern days popular media creation,
And audience response to that mix.

"John was leaning back against it as his partner
pressed closer."

"He could feel his breath moist and warm against
his cheek."

Liza, I told you before. Don't bring your
fanfiction to class.
Wha! it's a totally legitimate form of story.

Yeah so regarding my history paper? I'd like
to appeal?

Well for starters I hardly think the "Lannisters"
qualify as an example of royal dynasties of medieval europe.

Secondly this is just a ten page rant of what
you thought was wrong with the "Red Wedding" episode!

I'm the one who knocks! / You're the one who
knocks.

comments.text:
I was given an assignment to write about something including a wizard, a 
lightbulb, a candle, and a train. I basically made a Harry Potter fanfic 
where a wizard invents magic-powered light bulbs because electricity 
doesn't work well around large amounts of magic. The only one who noticed 
was my English teacher and my best friend.﻿

comments.author: Adreamofshadow

comments.text:
The thing is, though, fangirls are often even MORE aware of other's 
feelings than other people. Oftentimes, a fangirl loves a character because 
they emotionally connect with them.

Also, it's really not very fair to judge and entire group of people by the 
small sample you've interacted with.

And one more thing: please don't just throw around the term "retarded." It 
can be extremely hurtful to people who actually are mentally disabled.
